definition: (polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
a good dog deserves a bone (idiom)

sentences.english: Why did no one inform me of the change of plans?
sentences.chinese: 有勞博友告訴我正確的改法。

sentences.english: Would you kindly spell it for me?
Only striker Raul Gonzalez has been at Madrid longer than Guti.
sentences.chinese: 只有勞爾在皇馬效力的時間比古蒂長。

sentences.english: This is Echizen's cat, there are workers, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 這是越前的貓，有勞了，謝謝。

sentences.english: The past seems like a song, as well as a dream and fog.
sentences.chinese: 把“往事如歌，如夢如煙”譯成英文，有勞各位了。

sentences.english: A. Will you please find someone else for the chairmanship?
sentences.chinese: 有勞你另外找人做主席好嗎？

sentences.english: A. Would you please repair the TV for me?
The author raises the question "what about pain without gain?" because.
sentences.chinese: 作者提出“有勞無獲”的問題是因爲。
